intro: Turritis dregeana, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Turritis dregeana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
